tasks.title: Setup Supabase Authentication and RLS
tasks.description: Implement user authentication using Supabase Auth with email/password and configure Row-Level Security (RLS) on all data tables.
tasks.details:
1. Create a Supabase project
2. Configure authentication settings for email/password
3. Create database tables: `profiles`, `note_ingestions`, and `query_requests`
4. Set up RLS policies for each table to ensure users can only access their own data
5. Create helper functions for auth operations (login, signup, logout)
6. Implement auth context provider in React

Schema for tables:
- `profiles`: id (references auth.users), created_at, updated_at, additional user metadata
- `note_ingestions`: id, user_id (references profiles), linkedin_url, note_text, status, created_at, updated_at
- `query_requests`: id, user_id (references profiles), query_text, response_json, created_at

RLS policies should restrict access based on user_id matching the authenticated user's ID.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Unit tests for auth helper functions
2. Integration tests for signup, login, and logout flows
3. Test RLS policies by attempting to access data from different user accounts
4. Verify proper error handling for authentication failures

tasks.title: Implement Reusable Voice Input Component
tasks.description: Create a reusable React component that converts speech to text in real-time using the Web Speech API.
tasks.details:
1. Create a VoiceInput component that can be used in both ingestion and query screens
2. Implement Web Speech API integration:
   ```typescript
   const SpeechRecognition = window.SpeechRecognition || window.webkitSpeechRecognition;
   const recognition = new SpeechRecognition();
   recognition.continuous = true;
   recognition.interimResults = true;
   ```
3. Add start/stop recording functionality with appropriate UI indicators
4. Handle browser compatibility issues and provide fallbacks
5. Implement real-time transcription display
6. Add error handling for microphone access issues
7. Create props for customization and callback functions
8. Ensure component works on mobile browsers (Safari and Chrome)
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Unit tests for component rendering and state management
2. Mock Web Speech API for testing transcription functionality
3. Test browser compatibility across Chrome and Safari
4. Test error states and fallback mechanisms
5. Manual testing on mobile devices

tasks.title: Configure Progressive Web App (PWA)
tasks.description: Set up the application as a Progressive Web App to enable installability on mobile devices and offline functionality.
tasks.details:
1. Create a manifest.json file with app metadata:
```json
{
  "name": "Vibe Notes",
  "short_name": "Vibe Notes",
  "description": "Voice note-taking app for networking events",
  "start_url": "/",
  "display": "standalone",
  "background_color": "#ffffff",
  "theme_color": "#4285f4",
  "icons": [
    {
      "src": "/icons/icon-192.png",
      "sizes": "192x192",
      "type": "image/png"
    },
    {
      "src": "/icons/icon-512.png",
      "sizes": "512x512",
      "type": "image/png"
    }
  ]
}
```
2. Register a service worker for offline capabilities
3. Implement caching strategies for app assets
4. Create app icons in various sizes
5. Configure Next.js for PWA support
6. Implement install prompt and instructions
7. Test installability across devices
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Use Lighthouse to audit PWA compliance
2. Test installation process on iOS and Android devices
3. Verify offline functionality works as expected
4. Test service worker update process
5. Verify app icons display correctly on home screens
